newsitem.title: UK: Ldn freight rates weakening, no news on Gulf/Japan.
newsitem.headline: Ldn freight rates weakening, no news on Gulf/Japan.

text.p: London freight fixtures had a quiet day on Thursday with the U.S. market closed for Thanksgiving. But rates were showing fresh signs of weakening in the Atlantic and the Pacific.
The Baltic Freight Index (BFI) drifted down five points to 1,423 points.
There were no new US Gulf/Japan fixtures after recent trades done at $23 per tonne no combination, but traders said the key route could strengthen slightly early next week.
"We are expecting a 50 cents rise next week," said one.
Timecharter rates were disappointing for owners. Oinoussian Sky fixed at $12,500 and $240,000 bonus for the Far East by Goldbeam said to be for a USGulf/Japan trip.
Rates were previously in the $14-15 range, brokers said.

A few grain houses were looking for timecharter on US Gulf/Continent but otherwise the market was quiet. Demand was also shallow in US Gulf/Far East with not many Korean buyers around for mid-December.
"There are quite a lot of ships there chasing a few cargoes," said one.
Brokers said rates were generally steady in the Pacific but edging down in the Atlantic, except the USGulf/Japan.

On capers, a 120,000 dwt Sol was fixed for a Transatlantic voyage delivery Skaw Passero in December at $8,000 daily to Deiulemar which traders said confirmed the softer tone of prices. Searadiance was fixed at $13.50 from Roberts Bank to Lisbon.
Other reported Caper fixtures were BHP with Hay Port Rotterdam for mid-December at $12.95.

The Baltic Freight Exchange amended details of Hajin's fixture of the 1995 built Maria Bottiglieri 75,265 dwt which has been booked for Dec 14/22 delivery USGulf redelivery Far East at $14,000 daily plus $270,000 bonus.
On Wednesday the vessel was said taken by K-Line for delivery Antwerp early Dec trip via Brazil redelivery Indonesia at $15,000 daily.
